definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°

sentences.english: It's got a new government, you know, which hasn't governed before.
sentences.chinese: 它剛換了政府，一個從未執政過的新政府。

sentences.english: At no time, though, did Reagan ever criticize the United Nations specifically.
sentences.chinese: 但里根從未對聯合國提出過明確的批評。

sentences.english: Ylath never asked to be worshipped.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉斯從未尋求有人崇拜。

sentences.english: Harvey's friend has never been to Water World.
sentences.chinese: 哈維的朋友從未去過水上世界。

sentences.english: He never climbed trees as a boy because he was afraid that he would fall.
sentences.chinese: 他小時候從未爬過樹，因爲他怕跌下來。

sentences.english: Mrs…has never really got on with her daughter-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 老太太從未與兒媳婦兒真正和睦相處過。

sentences.english: Upon my word, I've never heard of such a thing.
sentences.chinese: 說實在話，我從未聽說過這種事情。

sentences.english: You never work, but spend a year on year.
sentences.chinese: 你們從未攜手，卻共度了年年月月。

sentences.english: The young author burned energy as if he never heard of resting.
sentences.chinese: 這位青年作家耗費精力，似乎從未聽說過休息。

sentences.english: Deborah:I never thought I would. There's a difference.
sentences.chinese: 這些年我從未覺得有什麼改變。

sentences.english: It's been non-stop football for me since I started when I was 17.
sentences.chinese: 自從我17歲參加正式比賽以來還從未停過工。

sentences.english: No man but a blockhead ever wrote except for money.
sentences.chinese: 除非是傻瓜，從未有人爲金錢以外的東西寫文章。

sentences.english: She opened her never-before-used set of watercolours and set to work.
sentences.chinese: 她打開自己從未用過的水彩畫工具，開始認真畫畫。

sentences.english: This was a new pathway into the creation of memories that had never been understood before.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個進入了從未在以前的記憶理解創造新的途徑。

sentences.english: He said she never supported any particular presidential candidate.
sentences.chinese: 他說她從未支持過任一總統候選人。

sentences.english: If ever I heard the like!
sentences.chinese: 從未聽到過象這樣的事情。

definition: always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
